name: J.K. Rowling
occupation: J.K. Rowling,who writes under the pen names J. K. Rowling and Robert Galbraith, is a British novelist and screenwriter who wrote the Harry Potter fantasy series. The books have won multiple awards, and sold more than 400 million copies. They have become the best-selling book series in history and been the basis for a series of films, over which Rowling had overall approval on the scripts and was a producer on the final films in the series.
achievements: Rowling has received honorary degrees from St Andrews University, the University of Edinburgh, Edinburgh Napier University, the University of Exeter which she attended, the University of Aberdeen and Harvard University, for whom she spoke at the 2008 commencement ceremony. In 2009 Rowling was made a Chevalier de la LÃ©gion d'honneur by French President Nicolas Sarkozy. In 2011 Rowling became an honorary Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh.

name: Audre Lorde
occupation: Audre Lorde was a writer, feminist, womanist, and civil rights activist. As a poet, she is best known for technical mastery and emotional expression, as well as her poems that express anger and outrage at civil and social injustices she observed throughout her life. Her poems and prose largely deal with issues related to civil rights, feminism, and the exploration of black female identity. In relation to non-intersectional feminism in the United States, Lorde famously said, "Those of us who stand outside the circle of this society's definition of acceptable women; those of us who have been forged in the crucibles of difference -- those of us who are poor, who are lesbians, who are Black, who are older -- know that survival is not an academic skill. It is learning how to take our differences and make them strengths. For the master's tools will never dismantle the master's house. They may allow us temporarily to beat him at his own game, but they will never enable us to bring about genuine change. And this fact is only threatening to those women who still define the master's house as their only source of support.
achievements: Audre Lorde was awarded the American Award and the Lambda Literary award for Lesbian Poetry. The American Book Award is an American literary award that annually recognizes a set of books and people for "outstanding literary achievement." She was given the Literary award for Lesbian Poetry for the amazing poems that she wrote and books she has written pertaining to LGBT.

name: Isabel Allende
occupation: Allende is an author who is dubbed to be the world's most widely read Spanish-language author.
achievements: Allende had earned many awards due to her books.

name: Alice Walker
occupation: Alice Malsenior Walker is an American novelist, short story writer, poet, and activist.
achievements: Walker has won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction, Guggenheim Fellowship for Creative Arts,and the National Book Award for Fiction.

name: Tarereh Mafi
occupation: Tahereh Mafi the author of the New York Times bestselling trilogy,The Shatter Me series and Futhermore novel
achievements: Mafi has written five books so far, all recieving world-wide fame for her narrations of the stories.

name: Renee Ahdieh
occupation: Ahdieh is an South-Korean author, mainly known for her young adult retelling duologies: The Wrath and The Dawn and the Flame in the Mist
achievements: The creation of  her books The Wrath and The Dawn, The Rose and The Dagger, and The Flame in The Mist

name: Sabaa Tahir
occupation: Sabaa Tahir is a young-adult fiction writer, who is best known for her latest series: An Ember in the Ashes.
achievements: The creation of  her books Ember in the Ashes and Torch Against the Night

achievements: She was awarded a MacArthur Genius Grant.

name: Toni Morrison
occupation: Toni Morrison is an American novelist, editor, teacher, and Professor Emeritus at Princeton University.
achievements: Morrison won the Pulitzer Prize and the American Book Award in 1988.Morrison was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1993.

name: Zora Neale Hurston
occupation: Zora Neale Hurston was an novelist, short story writer, folklorist, and anthropologist
achievements: Zora has won the awards The Charles MacArthur Award for Outstanding New Musical, Guggenheim Fellowship for Creative Arts, the Anisfield-Wolf Book Award, and the Bethune-Cookman College Award for Education and Human Relations.
